Class IOUtils

public class IOUtils
extends java.lang.Object

A set of useful static methods for working with files.

confirmDirectory

public static java.io.File confirmDirectory(java.lang.String directoryName)
                                     throws CSIOException
Make sure directory directoryName exists.

Parameters:
String - directoryName
Returns:
A file object contaning the directory in question.
Throws:
CSIOException - if the file isn't a writable, readable, directory.

getStringFromConsole

public static java.lang.String getStringFromConsole(java.lang.String theMessage,
                                                    boolean noNewline)
Get the user to enter a String

Parameters:
String - theMessage A message to be sent to Standard Output
boolean - noNewLine Whether a newline character is printed after theMessage.
Returns:
String whatever the user typed prior to presssing 'Enter'.

                            java.io.File newFile)
                     throws CSException
Copies a file.

Parameters:
File - oldFile the file you want copied
File - newFile the file you want it copied to
Throws:
CSException

loadFileIntoByteArray

public static byte[] loadFileIntoByteArray(java.io.File inFile)
                                    throws CSException
Loads a file into a byte array. Note that this will not work with really big files. Non-existant or zero length files are returned as a zero length array. This routine has been tested with files up to 1MB in size.

Parameters:
File - inFile the file you want copied
Returns:
byte[] a byte array
Throws:
CSException
Since:
JDBCWizard 4.0.2108

grep

                           java.io.File searchFile)
An extremely crude implemtation of 'grep'

loadFileIntoString

public static java.lang.String loadFileIntoString(java.io.File inFile)
                                           throws CSException
Loads a file into a String. Note that this will not work with really big files. Non-existant or zero length files are returned as a zero length String.This routine has been tested with files up to 1MB in size.

Parameters:
File - inFile the file you want turned into a String
Returns:
String a String
Throws:
CSException
Since:
JDBCWizard 4.0.2108

loadStringIntoFile

public static java.io.File loadStringIntoFile(java.lang.String theString,
                                              java.lang.String tempFilePrefix,
                                              java.lang.String tempFileSuffix,
                                              java.lang.String tempFileDir,
                                              LogInterface theLog)
                                       throws CSException
Turn a String into a File. A null String will be turned into a zero length file.

Parameters:
String - theString
String - tempFilePrefix
String - tempFileSuffix
String - tempFileDir
LogInterface - theLog
Throws:
CSException
Since:
JDBCWizard 4.0.2098

loadStringIntoFile

public static java.io.File loadStringIntoFile(java.lang.String theString,
                                              java.io.File newFile,
                                              LogInterface theLog)
                                       throws CSException
Turn a String into a File. A null String will be turned into a zero length file.

Parameters:
String - theString
File - theFile
Throws:
CSException
Since:
JDBCWizard 6.0.2746

loadCharArrayIntoFile

public static java.io.File loadCharArrayIntoFile(char[] theChars,
                                                 java.lang.String tempFilePrefix,
                                                 java.lang.String tempFileSuffix,
                                                 java.lang.String tempFileDir,
                                                 LogInterface theLog)
                                          throws CSException
Turn a char array into a Temporary File. A null value for theChars will be turned into a zero length file. java.io.File.createTempFile() is used to create what is supposed to be a unique file.

Parameters:
char[] - theChars The chars you wish to be turned into a temporary File
String - tempFilePrefix The prefix for the temporary file's name
String - tempFileSuffix The suffix for the temporary file's name
String - tempFileDir The directory for the temporary files.
LogInterface - A logging mechanism.
Throws:
CSException
Since:
JDBCWizard 4.0.2098

loadCharArrayIntoFile

public static java.io.File loadCharArrayIntoFile(char[] theChars,
                                                 java.io.File newFile,
                                                 LogInterface theLog)
                                          throws CSException
Turn a char array into a File. A null Array will be turned into a zero length file.

Parameters:
char[] - theChars
File - newFile
LogInterface -
Throws:
CSException
Since:
JDBCWizard 4.0.2108

loadByteArrayIntoFile

public static java.io.File loadByteArrayIntoFile(byte[] theBytes,
                                                 java.lang.String tempFilePrefix,
                                                 java.lang.String tempFileSuffix,
                                                 java.lang.String tempFileDir,
                                                 LogInterface theLog)
                                          throws CSException
Turn a byte array into a Temporary File. A null value for theBytes will be turned into a zero length file. java.io.File.createTempFile() is used to create what is supposed to be a unique file.

Parameters:
byte[] - theBytes The bytes you wish to be turned into a temporary File
String - tempFilePrefix The prefix for the temporary file's name
String - tempFileSuffix The suffix for the temporary file's name
String - tempFileDir The directory for the temporary files.
LogInterface - A logging mechanism.
Throws:
CSException
Since:
JDBCWizard 4.0.2098

loadFileIntoCharArray

public static char[] loadFileIntoCharArray(java.io.File inFile)
                                    throws CSException
Loads a file into a char array. Note that this will not work with really big files. Non-existant or zero length files are returned as a zero length array. This routine has been tested with files up to 1MB in size.

Parameters:
File - inFile the file you want copied
Returns:
char[] a char array
Throws:
